He doesn't get the slow if he actually uses it to go anywhere.

Also, he is an assassin. If he's using Playful and getting the slow off, it's a fair chance he's gonna have a bad time unless he caught someone out.

Honestly, it probably doesn't make sense to stay what it is if tanky builds are effective for him. Having burst avoidance/mitigation is cool, but having it on top of general tankiness, good damage, and mobility probably isn't cool. I'm not sure whether the best thing to do is to nerf Fizz's E, or to just make him do less damage with tanky builds.

I'm not sure whether the best thing to do is to nerf Fizz's E, or to just make him do less damage with tanky builds.

It's a little hard for you to do that, seeing as builds like the OPs don't actually rely on kits to deal damage. Spellblade scales off base AD, BoRK active scales off total health, and BoRK passive scales off current health. All of that is just fine, the only thing you could do to touch it would be to remove the damage amp from Fizz's Chum the Waters, but that counterplay is very much necessary for people to feel that assassin Fizz isn't such a mindless QWE machine. 

The problem is that Riot keeps putting damage on items in addition to offensive stats. We don't need that. Champions who have perfectly balanced kits do not need bonus damage on top of bonus damage on top of their kits. Luden's Echo, Lich Bane, and Blade of the Ruined King add so much additional damage without really paying for it in cost of stat or slot efficiency. BoRK gives lifesteal and attack speed and a small amount of AD, and since all of those stats scale off each other, it's a very slot efficient item when you combine it with other marksman items that give more AD, more AS, or more crit individually. BoRK is a great all-rounder item that also adds damage to a champion's kit for no reason. Lich Bane gives 80 AP, mana, and move speed, and adds a 50% AP modifier to each of a champion's abilities, provided that champion can weave auto attacks between them. And then there's Luden's Echo...which adds 400+40% AP to a champion's poke or rotation. Unnecessary. 

And because these items add so much on their own, champions who build them feel unbalanced because their kits were just fine before they got so much extra damage from their items, and now people are calling for champions like Vayne, Fizz and Ahri to be nerfed simply because of their item builds.

I think the issue here is not any part of his damage, but his E's design. 

Before hitting him too hard, we should take it slow and do a few easy nerfs, like making his E's landing hitbox actually match the visuals. This will also have the added benefit of making Fizz have to put himself at a bit more risk when trying to use E offensively. 

Also, increase the delay in which he can land from the pole. This will force him to be untargetable for a slightly longer amount of time, but give you more time to think about what he's doing and where he's going.

If he's still a problem after these nerfs, then I believe we should be looking at his bases and ratios.

I think the issue comes from his passive. He innately blocks damage from basic attacks better than {{champion:32}} (!) even in the late-game, and from what I understand flat damage reduction works _really_ well with tanky itemization. It definitely doesn't look like the best fit for a squishy assassin who's meant to have windows of extreme vulnerability while he's not on his troll pole, so it would likely be worth removing the flat damage reduction and perhaps buffing his base armor/armor growth in compensation. As for him lacking a passive, at the very worst you could move Seastone Trident's passive rend effect to his innate and work from there.

The idea of his passive is to help him early on against harras and msotly minion aggro.
If fizz wants to trade in lane, he will always get minon aggro, which for a squishy usually is brutal early on.
So the probably better aproach wpuld be to slightly buff the passive numbers, but change it to be applyed befor the %mitigation from armor rather than after, takeing away the tank/lategame synergie of it.

I don't think an under-the-hood change like that would be the best thing to do to any champion, particularly since it would be super-low on visibility while having a ton of hidden power changes. Making an effect exceptional just so that it works less with other effects also doesn't sound like the way to go. Considering how all minion damage is physical, increasing Fizz's armor bases would provide mitigation that wouldn't interact as weirdly with tank itemization, and in the absolute worst case his current passive could just be restricted to minions.

to reach that value from armor alone you need ~45armor, so nearly 30 more armor than now...

Also, since Dorans shield works already as pre-mitigation, it wouldn't be 'exceptional '...

Yes, you point out that FIzz's escape/gap opener/closer is very low.  Then you fail to point out that EVERY OTHER ASSASSIN in the game has some kind of ranged move on a basic ability.  And the ones that have pretty weak poke like Akali/Katrina have resets.  Zed/LB have instant port backs yet have good ranged poke.   Fizz no, he must go in melee to any damage unless he wants to use his ult for just poke.  The ridiculous assessment some people have about champions is hilarious.  Look at what other assassins have and then realize what Fizz is lacking and why he has the invulnerability and low cds in the first place.  He absolutely has to have the most all in damage compared to any other assassins because of his lack of healing (some get it inherit, ADs get it from lifesteal),  and his lack of poke (every other assassin has some or they are given resets to make up for their weaker poke like akali/kat) and his lack of range  (all of LB's spells are range and autos are range,  yet she can port around anywhere).   Most other assassins can poke down the enemy to 60% and then all in, NOT FIZZ, he must go into melee range to trade.  He also has mana constraints unlike a portion of the assassins who are manaless or have zero resources in the case of katrina.  Learn to actually assess the game correctly and then construct better feedback on the champion.  If tank Fizz is too strong, then nerfing his CDS are not the answer as AP fizz absolutely needs it based on his weaknesses.   Nerfing his base damage and upping his Ratios so that he actually MUST get some AP into his builds could work.  A tankier AP build should be able to work but not one with zero AP.
